section.name: About PDS Registry
section.p: PDS Registry provides functionality for tracking, searching, auditing, locating, and maintaining artifacts within the system. These artifacts can range from data files and label files, schemas, dictionary definitions for objects and elements, services, etc. The core functionality for this component is satisfied by Apache Solr.

For Build 9b (June 2019), the Registry and Search components of the PDS4 system received a major upgrade and significant re-design to greater leverage the power of Apache Solr. We are continuing to improve our documentation, but please do not hesitate to send questions, comments, change requests and bug reports to the PDS Operator at pds_operator@jpl.nasa.gov and we would be happy to help work through any issues you are having.

section.name: PDS Registry and Related Software

ul.li: Java is required to run Solr, Harvest, Registry Manager and other tools.
Registry data is stored in Apache Solr.
Registry Manager command-line tool is designed to load, delete and export registry data. It can also create and delete registry collection in Solr.
Harvest is a tool to crawl and extract metadata from PDS4 files. Extracted metadata is stored in an "intermediate" XML file which can be loaded into Solr by Registry Manager or Solr post tool.
